meanings.definition: A person who makes comments or observations.
meanings.sent1: The remarker in class always had something to say about the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The book club remarker shared insightful thoughts on the characters.
meanings.sent3: The remarker at the party had everyone laughing with their witty remarks.
meanings.sent4: She was a remarker of the stars, always pointing out constellations in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The little girl was a keen remarker, noticing every detail in the painting.

meanings.definition: To make a comment or observation.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, she would often remarker on the new project.
meanings.sent2: He likes to remarker on the weather whenever we go for a walk.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to remarker on the birds outside the window.
meanings.sent4: She would remarker on the passing clouds as if they held secrets.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to remarker on the historical event.
